thing-type.label: ZEN71 Paddle Switch (On/Off)
thing-type.description:
Paddle Switch (On/Off)

Overview

Z-Wave on/off paddle switch, 700 series, operating in compatibility mode.


Inclusion Information

1.  Put hub in inclusion mode

2.  Tap UP three (3) times


Exclusion Information

1.  Bring hub close to switch, if possible

2.  Put hub in exclusion mode

3.  Tap DOWN three (3) times


Wakeup Information

parameter.name: config_1_0
parameter.label: 1: On/Off Paddle Orientation
parameter.description:
Reverse default on/off operation or set to toggle mode

Overview

Choose if you want the upper paddle to turn the light on or turn the light off when tapped.

options.option: Upper paddle turns the light on, lower paddle turns it off (default)
Upper paddle turns the light off, lower paddle turns it on
Any paddle turns light on/off

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: LED Indicator Control
parameter.description:
Adjust LED function

Overview

Choose if you want the LED indicator to turn on when the switch (light) is on or off, or if you want it to remain on or off at all times.

NOTE: tap the upper paddle 6 times quickly to change this mode.

options.option: LED indicator is on when switch is off, LED indicator is off when swit
LED indicator is on when switch is on, LED indicator is off when switc
LED indicator is always OFF
LED indicator is always ON

parameter.name: config_3_4
parameter.label: 3: Auto Turn-Off Timer
parameter.description:
How long the switch remains on

Overview

Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-off timer function (the time after which you want the switch to automatically turn off once it has been turned on).

Values other than 0, up to 65535, are the timer length, in minutes.

options.option: Timer disabled (default)

parameter.name: config_5_4
parameter.label: 5: Auto Turn-On Timer
parameter.description:
How long the switch remains off

Overview

Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-on timer function (the time after which you want the switch to automatically turn on once it has been turned off).

Values other than 0, up to 65535, are the timer length, in minutes.

options.option: Timer disabled (default)

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: On Off Status After Power Failure
parameter.description:
How switch reacts to power failures

Overview

Set the on off status for the switch after power failure.

options.option: Forced to OFF (regardless of state prior to power outage)
Forced to ON (regardless of state prior to power outage)
Remembers and restores on/off status after power failure (default)

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: Enable/Disable Scene Control
parameter.description:
Whether scene control functionality is enabled

Overview

Enable or disable scene control functionality for quick double tap triggers.

options.option: Scene control disabled (default)
Scene control enabled

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: Smart Bulb Mode: Enable/Disable Paddle
parameter.description:
Allow or disallow local control (paddle)

Overview

Enable or disable local on/off control. If enabled, you’ll only be able to control the connected light via Z-Wave. Scenes and other functionality will still be available through paddles.

NOTE: tap the upper paddle 10 times quickly to change this mode. NOTE: hold the lower paddle for 10 seconds until the LED indicator starts blinking, then within 2 seconds, tap the upper paddle 5 times quickly to change this mode. The LED indicator will stay solid green for 3 seconds to confirm the change.

options.option: Physical paddle control disabled
Physical paddle control enabled (default)
Physical paddle and Z-Wave control disabled

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: 3-Way Switch Type
parameter.description:
Two options for type of 3-way switch

Overview

Choose the type of 3-way switch you want to use with this switch in a 3-way set-up.

options.option: Regular mechanical 3-way on/off switch (default)
Momentary switch, click once to change status (light on or off)

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: Reporting Behavior for Parameter 11
parameter.description:
Set reporting behavior for disabled physical control

Overview

Whether to ignore status and not change LED state when physical control (11) disabled.

options.option: Switch always reports status and changes LED state (default)
No status or LED state change when physical control disabled

parameter.name: config_15_1
parameter.label: 15: LED Brightness Level
parameter.description:
How bright the LED is

Overview

Choose the LED indicator's brightness level.

options.option: Bright (100%)
Medium (60%) (default)

parameter.name: config_16_1
parameter.label: 16: Association Reports
parameter.description:
How the switch reports paddle control

Overview

Choose how the switch reports its status back to the hub.

options.option: Z-Wave control = binary; paddle control = basic set
Z-Wave control and paddle control = binary
